data.title: "Targeted-units" (red) selection boxes do not appear on already selected units
data.body:
Tested on: release-20150919, playtest-20151213 

When your units are already selected and you try to target them with the iron curtain (possibly chrono shift as well - not tested) the additional "targeted units" boxes (red) do not appear. Only the "+" shaped area is visible on ground - but is sometimes harder to see.

Current behaviour:
![iconselectedunits](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/11775256/8f4fdc50-a23d-11e5-80a8-2693d413994b.jpg)

Suggested:
![suggested_iconselectedunits](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/11775259/9600ff02-a23d-11e5-9eba-38319c86c732.jpg)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29100903-targeted-units-red-selection-boxes-do-not-appear-on-already-selected-units?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Changing the volume / notification on Ubuntu crashes the game
data.body:
In any of OpenRA's mods, when I press Volume Up/Volume Down on my keyboard in-game, the game freezes, and I have to switch to another terminal (Ctrl + Alt + F1-6), and kill openra, compiz and nautilus to get it working again.
I don't know if this is because the volume itself or the Gnome/Ubuntu desktop notification.

data.title: [Question] helping out
data.body:
Hi, first of: huge kudos for this project - amazing work! I really would like to help out, but I don't really have prior experience in C#. Do you think I could still help out via learning by doing? If not that's fine too, just curious what your opinion on this is.

Really want to see Tiberian Sun happen ;)

data.title: Color validator is rejecting most colors on the ~left half of the color chooser.
data.body: This is silly.  If we really do mean to be rejecting this much of the color space, then the picker should be adjusted to not show this area of rejected colors.

data.title: Reimplement Primary and Fake tags using WithDecoration.
data.body:
Followup to #10104.  This removes the legacy `ITags` interface, and instead uses the `WithDecoration` trait for rendering the primary and fake building labels.

I had to first rework `WithDecoration` and the TS EMP implementation to follow our rendering conventions, which makes this a bit more complicated than it otherwise would have been.

This also fixes the UI decorations (rank / spy / upgrade star) pixel doubling with the world.

data.title: Change AllowInvalidPlacement rules
data.body:
Instead of allowing placement of a building literally anywhere (including miles off the map area), we now ensure at least one cell of the footprint is on the map.

Currently, only concrete in Dune makes use of `AllowInvalidPlacement` and is the only thing that will be affected in the default mods. This change means you can no longer accidentally place concrete off the map where it has no use.

data.title: Ensure LaysTerrain doesn't access cells outside the map
data.body: Fixes #10212.

data.title: [prep] Fix AttackMove not working properly under certain conditions
data.body: This is the same as #10182, just based on prep.

data.title: IndexOutOfRangeException in OpenRA.Mods.D2k.Traits.LaysTerrain.AddedToWorld
data.body:
Dune 2000 Mod at Version playtest-20151129
on map e1d72e09ab83a0ac5982e92ad1f037e697b429ef (The Fight by kiores).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000

Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array

   vid OpenRA.CellLayer`1.get_Item(MPos uv)
   vid OpenRA.Map.GetTerrainIndex(CPos cell)
   vid OpenRA.Map.GetTerrainInfo(CPos cell)

data.title: Fix the idle animation of the hostBuilding in Rearm.cs
data.body:
using the damage state of the reloaded actor.

Fixes #10209.
See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10141#issuecomment-164237863.

data.title: Add enter behaviour field to Infiltrates/EngineerRepair/RepairsBridges.
data.body: Followup to #10092.

data.title: Damaged airplanes and airfields animation
data.body:
Land a yak / mig with less than half health on an airfield. Once the reload animation finishes the building will change to the critically damaged animation frame. 

Will stay like this until the next reload animation plays with a plane on more than half health.

On bleed.

data.title: Added some performance comments
data.body:
I've added some comments to help explain some parts of the code in performance sensitive areas - as well as to call out areas where the code needs to be fast to avoid people accidentally changing loops into LINQ and such in hot paths. I've prefixed such comments with `PERF:` for searchability.

The PR also includes a few commits with some minor cleanup.

data.title: YAML merging issues
data.body: Since #9710, yaml rules that used to be fine in our missions and mini-games don't work anymore (see [irc logs](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=12&day=12#16:10:29), for example).

data.title: Let spawned soviet vehicles attack move on Survival02
data.body: Fixes #10204.

data.title: Fix and rebalance Fort Lonestar
data.body:
This solves some crashes and also tries to make the minigame playable again
(and introduces different difficulties).

Fixes #10100.

data.title: Survival 02
data.body:
The first few heavy tanks just drive through the base without attacking.

On bleed.

data.title: Rewrite line renderer: Part 2 (remove LineRenderer plus other cleanups)
data.body:
Followup to and depends on #10148 (which appears as the first 10 commits in this pr).

The main visual change here is the ability to draw connected line strips, which fixes the holes that can appear at the corners of rectangles and the beacon triangle.  It also fixes the position of the voxel shadow bounding box in the rendering geometry visualization.

data.title: URLError on resource.openra.net
data.body:
I can see a map like http://resource.openra.net/maps/1801 and it works.
If a map doesn't exist like http://resource.openra.net/maps/99999999, I get back to the index.
If I try to go to http://resource.openra.net/maps/1802, server "crash".
I don't know if other maps are affected.
![urlerror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/11757136/3f87746a-a05f-11e5-8846-ee26e1e35a15.png)

data.title: Optionally discard resources when silo capacity has been reached
use cd option on fresh openra start ends in an infinite loop
data.body:
reproduce on i686, arch linux, openra 20150919
1. download CD1_ALLIED_DISC.ISO from CNCNZ.com
2. mount it to /mnt (-o loop)
3. delete ~/.openra
4. start openra
5. when asked about content: go with "use cd" option
6. progressbar displays but then dialog pops up still asking about cd

installer manages to extract and copy the following files from cd:
allies.mix
conquer.mix
general.mix
interior.mix
REDALERT.MIX
russian.mix
scores.mix
snow.mix
sounds.mix
temperat.mix

data.title: More graceful hardware cursor failing
data.body:
- Ensure we grab enough of the error message so it shows up in the debug log (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10172#issuecomment-162100039)
- If hardware cursors fail, don't change the settings. This disables them for the session rather than forever. (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10172#issuecomment-162560939)

data.title: TraitInfoInterface base for interfaces implemented by trait infos
data.body: Neither @pchote nor myself liked using `ITraitInfo` for both trait infos and interfaces (for queries) implemented by trait infos.

data.title: Playtest replays not working ("unknown map") after same (custom) map played on bleed
data.body:
Playtest 20151129, Windows 8.1 

If you create and play a custom map on current playtest and later play the same map on bleed the playtest replay doesn't work anymore (loses map ~association), error: "Unknown map". 

How to re-create: 
On current playtest: 
1. Create a new custom map (it can be a simple empty map), name it & save it (default location "^maps/ra") 
2. Play the map (skirmish, you can surrender) 
3. (optional) Verify that the replay is working 

On bleed: 
4. Play the same map (skirmish, surrender) 
5. (optional) Verify that the new replay works also 

Back on playtest 
5. Ty to load the replay of the previous (first) game 
It should report "Unknown map" and there is no thumbnail for the replay. 

To fix it: 
Open the map in the playtest's editor (it normally shows in browser) and just save it unchanged (overwrite). Again the default location here is "^maps/ra" for me. 

This only happens if you play the playtest's map with bleed (and come back to playtest) and not with current release (which is older than the current playtest) 

It also doesn't happen with official maps - just custom ones.
